contextId.information: These phrases refer to these animals in general, not to a specific wolf or leopard. These are all strong animals that attack and eat other animals. AT: "Wolves ... leopards ... young lions ... bears ... Lions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
contextId.quote: The wolf ... the leopard ... the young lion ... the bear ...  The lion

contextId.information: "the Assyrian" refers to a person from Assyria, but represents anyone from Assyria who comes to Egypt. AT: "Assyrians will come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
This refers to a person from Egypt, but represents anyone from Egypt who comes to Assyria. AT: "Egyptians" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
This is not a specific city but cities in general. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
